text: William Mann Clayton (July 14, 1884, London, England – April 5, 1946, New York City)https://www.pulpartists.com/Clayton.html was an American pulp magazine publisher. His company published Snappy Stories, a men's magazine which was launched in 1912. He published many western pulps, and in 1930 launched Astounding Stories, which is still being published (as of 2016) under the title Analog Science Fiction and Fact.Ashley, Time Machines, p. 69. ==Notes== ==References== * ==External links== *Analog Science Fiction and Fact official web site Category:1884 births Category:1946 deaths Category:American businesspeople Category:American pulp magazine publishers (people) Category:20th-century businesspeople
